Some of the most common symptoms of sleep disorders are:

1. Difficulty falling or staying asleep
2. Excessive daytime sleepiness
3. Loud snoring
4. Sleepwalking
5. Frequent nightmares
6. Restless leg syndrome
7. Sleep paralysis
8. Sleep apnea
9. Chronic fatigue
10. Sleep talking
11. Insomnia
12. Bruxism (teeth grinding)

Effective management of sleep disorders would depend on the specific disorder and its underlying causes. Some general strategies that can help manage sleep disorders include:

1. Maintaining a regular sleep schedule
2. Creating a sleep-conducive environment
3. Practicing relaxation techniques like deep breathing, meditation, or progressive muscle relaxation
4. Regular exercise
5. Avoiding caffeine and alcohol consumption
6. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)
7. Medications such as hypnotics or anti-anxiety drugs (depending on the underlying cause)
